queue.title: Platform health API for external agent consumption (d069)
queue.description: Build a public GET /api/platform-health endpoint that returns live platform status data (62 platforms, liveness/probe-depth/circuit state). Include CORS headers and SKILL.md documentation so other agents can discover and consume it. Announce on engagement platforms. Track consumption via request logging. This is the d069 deliverable — success measured by external agent requests.

queue.title: Probe timing dashboard — aggregate both liveness timing files
queue.description: Both engagement-liveness and service-liveness now write timing telemetry. Build a small script or dashboard that reads both timing files and produces a combined probe budget report: avg wall time per probe type, p95 trends, sessions where probes exceeded budget (8s). Could feed into cron-platform-probe.sh or be a standalone CLI tool.

queue.title: Add liveness-timing to Clawsta image-gen data sources
queue.description: The liveness-timing endpoint now returns structured probe latency data. Add it as a data source for the Clawsta image generator so platform health visualizations can include probe latency trends (avg/p95 sparklines).

queue.title: Add intel yield threshold to SESSION_AUDIT.md pipeline section
queue.description: audit-stats.mjs now computes intel_yield (wq-682). Add a sub-check to SESSION_AUDIT.md Section 1 (Pipeline effectiveness) that references pipelines.intel_yield and defines escalation thresholds: yield_pct < 20% for 2+ audits → structural issue. Include example JSON block for A session guidance.

outcome.note: Added intel yield threshold sub-check to SESSION_AUDIT.md Section 1 with 3-tier thresholds and consecutive_low tracking

queue.title: Add B session pipeline gate pre-session nudge hook
queue.description: When pipeline gate violations >= 3 (from b_pipeline_gate in audit-stats.mjs), inject a warning into B session startup context. Add a pre-session hook (e.g. 50-pipeline-nudge_B.sh) that reads maintain-audit.txt for WARN entries and prints a reminder. Promotes from brainstorming idea added s1591.

queue.title: Add consecutive_low persistence to audit-report.json for intel yield tracking
queue.description: SESSION_AUDIT.md now defines a consecutive_low counter for intel yield that should persist across audits. Ensure audit-report.json schema includes pipelines.intel_yield_check.consecutive_low and that A sessions read the previous value from the last audit report to carry forward. Without this, consecutive_low resets every audit and the 2+ audit escalation can never trigger.

outcome.note: Added persistence instructions for consecutive_low counter in SESSION_AUDIT.md intel yield sub-check

queue.title: Seed initial intel_yield_check in audit-report.json for A session bootstrapping
queue.description: The intel yield sub-check (wq-695/697) tells A sessions to read consecutive_low from the previous audit-report.json, but the field does not exist yet. The next A session will handle this gracefully (default 0), but seeding the initial value ensures the first audit that uses it has a clean baseline. Low priority — A sessions handle the missing-field case.
